result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:21 AM Defendant Crystal G Mendoza in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson appeared by video for Crystal G Mendoza.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Randy Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Date remains as previously set.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

1:15 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Crystal G Mendoza in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Crystal G Mendoza. 

Preliminary time limits previously waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Court sets all defendants matters along for the purposes of scheduling as the Court found case 22CF1016 has not had a preliminary hearing or a waiver of preliminary hearing.
